topic.title: PHY <-> MAC <-> Interlaken Datapaths

li.p: 10GE (3a), 25GE (3b), 50GE (3c), 100GE (3d), 200GE (3e), 400GE (3f) Ethernet clients to Interlaken via Ethernet MACs.

body.p: On the receive path, the different Ethernet clients (10GE, 25GE, 50GE, 100GE, 400GE) coming from the SERDES go through the PHY RX blocks that performs the PMA, FEC and PCS receive functions. The traffic then pass through the RX MAC that delineate Ethernet packets, deleting preamble, all idles and O/S. These packets are forwarded and stored into the DCPB packet buffer. The RX MAC provides full PMON while the FEPP_I provides packet insertion and extraction capabilities. The packets are then extracted from DCPB packet buffer, go through the COPI subsystem and delivered over the Interlaken interface.

On the transmit path, the packets are received over the Interlaken interface, go through the COPI subsystem and stored into the DCPB packet buffer. These packets are received from the DCPB packet buffer. The MAC provides full PMON while the FEPP_E provides packet insertion and extraction capabilities. The MAC adds the preamble, idles and OS. The PHY TX block performs the PMA, FEC and PCS transmit functions. The PHY rate information (normally nominal) is carried for each channel to the SERDES outside the ENET subsystem.

draft-comment.author: hookerje
draft-comment.i: [DDD/HWS] SW/Apps to add API and datapath segment configuration content here.
